intro: Leucostegia immersa, commonly known as the water bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and tiny, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is known for its ability to trap small aquatic organisms, using specialized bladder-like structures to capture prey. Its leaves are often submerged, while its flowers may emerge just above the water surface. Leucostegia immersa plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microscopic life.
